name: Peter Drucker
background: Father of modern management. Coined 'knowledge worker'. Consulted for GE, IBM, Intel. Emphasized management as a liberal art combining ethics, economics, psychology, and philosophy.

principles.name: Management is doing things right; leadership is doing the right things
principles.description: Efficiency and effectiveness are different. Optimize for outcomes, not activity. The most efficient pursuit of the wrong goal is still failure.
principles.falsification: When execution speed is the constraint and the goal is clearly correct

principles.name: What gets measured gets managed
principles.description: Metrics drive behavior. Choose measurements carefully because they become de facto goals. Bad metrics produce bad outcomes even with good intentions.
principles.falsification: When important outcomes are unmeasurable and measurement distorts behavior (Goodhart's Law)

principles.name: The best way to predict the future is to create it
principles.description: Don't forecast - act. Entrepreneurs shape markets, they don't just serve them. Proactive strategy beats reactive adaptation.
principles.falsification: When environmental forces genuinely constrain options and adaptation is the only viable strategy
